title: Gold (material)
data:
**Gold** is a [material](/wiki/Material "Material") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [3.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [4 References](#References)

## Description

Gold is an inherently [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion")-proofed type of metal. A few items in the game are made of gold:

- The [gold pieces](/wiki/Gold_piece "Gold piece") used as currency for zorkmids
- [Rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") with the [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") of "gold ring"
- The [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation")

[Metallivores](/wiki/Metallivores "Metallivores") can eat any gold item minus the Candelabrum, which tends to occur in the form of [rock moles](/wiki/Rock_mole "Rock mole") and [xorns](/wiki/Xorn "Xorn") eating any gold they encounter while [tunneling](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel") or [phasing](/wiki/Phasing "Phasing").

A noncursed [scroll of gold detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_gold_detection "Scroll of gold detection") will reveal all gold pieces and gold golems on the level; a blessed scroll will additionally reveal other items made of gold. [Polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling") enough gold items may create a [gold golem](/wiki/Gold_golem "Gold golem").

## Strategy

Depending on which ring they represent, gold rings may be worth [eating](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") for their intrinsics.

## Variants

Variants often add other items made of gold, and the [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") system used in many variants incorporates gold as a potential material for metallic objects. Monster interactions with gold are also altered depending on the variant:

- [Leprechauns](/wiki/Leprechaun "Leprechaun") and other monsters with gold-based attacks can target items made of gold as well as money - this also applies to a player [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into those forms.
- [Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus") is often given a set of gold armor, sometimes with a gold weapon to boot.
- Gold golems may drop other items made of gold alongside gold coins upon death.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") objects including those of dwarvish make have a very rare chance of being made of gold, as do elven weapons and shields. Gold is a heavy material and tends to be impractical as armor - gold armor has 2 less AC compared to its iron counterparts (minimum 0).

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), gold weapons deal more damage to targets vulnerable to their [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"): +1d20 when blessed (instead of +1d4), or +2d9 when cursed (instead of +1d9).

Gold golems are often generated with gold weapons, and [Aurumach Rilmani](/wiki/Aurumach_Rilmani "Aurumach Rilmani") (including [Center of All](/wiki/Center_of_All "Center of All")) will generate with gold weapons and armor. [Ara Kamerel](/wiki/Ara_Kamerel "Ara Kamerel") project their images onto gold golems, and will also generate with gold items.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), gold is similarly heavy, with 50% more weight compared to iron, and gives 2 less AC as armor - however, blunt weapons made of gold gain a +2 damage bonus. As of version 8.0, cursed gold items will "stick" to your inventory and cannot be dropped or bagged, similar to the [loadstone](/wiki/Loadstone "Loadstone") in vanilla *NetHack* (which is not present in xNetHack).

Two new randomized appearances for wands, the "gold wand" and the "gilded wand", are composed of gold. [Itlachiayaque](/wiki/Itlachiayaque "Itlachiayaque"), the [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") for the variant, is a gold [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"); [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword") has its base material changed to gold. Leprechauns are also capable of stealing any item that is made of gold in addition to your money.

Croesus will always generate with a gold two-handed sword and gold body armor - the armor has a 1⁄8 to be plate mail, and will otherwise be [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Blessed [thiefstones](/wiki/Thiefstone "Thiefstone") are capable of "stealing" gold coins and other items made of gold and teleporting them to a "stash" square if you [apply](/wiki/Apply "Apply") or [rub](/wiki/Rub "Rub") one against them. They can also teleport gold golems to their keyed square if you hit them with a [wielded](/wiki/Wield "Wield") or [thrown](/wiki/Thrown "Thrown") blessed thiefstone - you can also teleport yourself this way if you [rub](/wiki/Rub "Rub") it on your hand while polymorphed into a gold golem.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [goldbugs](/index.php?title=Goldbug\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Goldbug (page does not exist)") can eat any gold objects in your inventory using their bite attack.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [xNetHack 0.7 src/makemon.c, line 250](https://github.com/copperwater/xNetHack/blob/7.0-savebreaking/src/makemon.c#L250)
